Kris danes odleti po zdravje!
Fantič, za katerega je zbirala denar vsa Slovenija, opoldne poleti iz Ljubljane. Zasebno letalo je odstopil Miodrag Kostić, ki bo tudi kril stroške poleta.
06 Nov 2019, 05:59 by Moni Černe



Kmalu bo v ZDA. FOTO: Moni Černe



Revolucionarno, a drago zdravilo



Na kliniki Ronalda Reagana že pričakujejo Krisa.



S tem letalom bo poletel Kris s starši, ljubljanskim zdravnikom, pilotom, kopilotom in eno stevardeso. FOTO: facebook



Ana Jerak in Matteo Zudich sta hvaležna Slovencem za neprecenljivo pomoč. FOTO: Roman Šipić



Robert Krajnc je članek iz Novic poslal Miodragu Kostiću. FOTO: Leon Vidic


LJUBLJANA – Enaindvajsetmesečni Kris Zudich iz koprskega naselja Markovec bo danes opoldne z zasebnim letalom gulfstream G450 60-letnega poslovneža Miodraga Kostića, doma iz srbskega Vrbasa, poletel z letališča Jožeta Pučnika v Ljubljani. Pristal bo na letališču v Los Angelesu, od koder ga bodo prepeljali na kliniko Ronalda Reagana.Mali Kris, ki je v svoji najhujši obliki bolezni spinalne mišične atrofije združil vso Slovenijo, bo v letalu, ki bo s postanki vred potovalo približno 20 ur, skupaj s 26-letnim očetom Matteom Zudichem, 30-letno mamo Ano Jerak, ljubljanskim zdravnikom specialistom, od posadke pa bodo na krovu pilot, kopilot in ena stevardesa. Letalo, ki ima s polnim rezervoarjem kerozina okoli 10.000 kilometrov doleta, se bo zaradi točenja goriva ustavilo samo enkrat, in sicer v Kanadi.
Ganil ga je članek v Novicah
Sicer pa bo to drag polet. Iz neuradnih, a zanesljivih virov smo namreč izvedeli, da stane ena ura takšnega poleta približno 4000 evrov, kar pomeni, da bo 80-urni let, dvakrat tja in nazaj, stal okoli 320.000 evrov. Vse to bo plačal Miodrag Kostić, ustanovitelj MK Group iz Beograda, holdinga, ki se usmerja predvsem v kmetijsko dejavnost, je pa tudi upravitelj družb, s katerimi v celoti poseduje Gorenjsko banko, hotel Kempinski v Portorožu, zraven pa je tudi večinski lastnik Letališča Portorož in še česa.


Robert Krajnc je članek iz Novic poslal Miodragu Kostiću. FOTO: Leon Vidic

Razkrivamo pa še, da je bil prav direktor Letališča Portorož, 49-letni Robert Krajnc iz Sečovelj, ki ima tudi sam vnuka z imenom Kris, tisti človekoljub, ki ga je zgodba o bolnem dečku tako zelo prizadela. Ter da je potem Miodragu Kostiću poslal članek, ki je bil 24. septembra objavljen v Slovenskih novicah, ter predlagal, da podajo Krisu roko pomoči.Akcija je stekla neverjetno hitro. Krajnc je s kolegi že ob dnevu odprtih vrat Letališča Portorož, 28. septembra, zbiral pomoč za Krisa, v strogi tajnosti pa je na željo Kostića več kot mesec dni ostalo, so nam povedali naši viri, da bo slednji odstopil letalo in kril astronomske stroške prevoza.
4000 evrov stane ura leta.
Izvedeli smo tudi, da bi letalo s Krisom lahko poletelo z letališča v Portorožu, ki je od njegovega doma oddaljeno zgolj 17 kilometrov, a zaradi birokratskih ovir, predvsem po zaslugi ministrstva za okolje in prostor, s katerimi se že desetletje intenzivno ukvarja prav direktor Krajnc, to ni mogoče. Pista, dolga 1200 metrov in široka 30, je za varen vzlet ob napovedanem slabem vremenu prekratka, da bi jo podaljšali, pa ne dobijo dovoljenj.»Zaradi letala, ki bo polno goriva in posledično težje, je potrebna namreč večja vzletna hitrost pa tudi daljša pista, Kris ob napovedani burji zato ne more poleteti iz Portoroža. Če bi bila pista daljša 200 metrov, bi lahko,« je pojasnil Krajnc.Poklicali smo tudi Krisove starše. Mama Ana Jerak je dan pred poletom dejala, da je Kris dobro, da so na polet pripravljeni, na naše vprašanje, ali jih je poti kaj strah, pa je povedala, da posebne nervoze zaradi samega poleta ni, čeprav so doslej leteli le enkrat, aprila letos je to bilo, in še to zelo na kratko. »Veste, na strah nimamo niti časa pomisliti,« je še dejala.Dobil bo najdražje zdravilo na svetuKris bo teden dni po prihodu prejel najdražji enkratni odmerek zdravila na svetu, 5,5 mililitra zolgensme, po mnenju stroke je to revolucionarno zdravilo, prejeti pa ga mora najpozneje do drugega leta starosti, tega bo dopolnil 28. januarja. Za zdravilo je bilo odštetih dva milijona evrov – požrtvovalni Slovenci so sicer zbrali skoraj 4 milijone –, Kris pa se bo domov vrnil po dveh oziroma štirih mesecih.Krisova mamica in očka sta vse doslej živela za dan, ko bo njun otrok odšel čez lužo in prejel zdravilo, in ga po zaslugi malega, a srčnega slovenskega naroda naposled tudi dočakala. Za kar sta seveda vsem od srca hvaležna.

Chris goes flying for health today!
A boy for whom she raised money all over Slovenia at noon from Ljubljana. The private jet was resigned by Miodrag Kostic, who will also cover the cost of the flight.
06 Nov 2019, 05:59 by Moni Cherne



It will be in the US soon. PHOTO: Moni Cherne



A revolutionary but expensive drug



They're already expecting Chris at the Ronald Reagan Clinic.



This aircraft will be flown by Kris with his parents, a Ljubljana doctor, a pilot, a co-pilot and one flight attendant. PHOTO: facebook



Ana Jerak and Matteo Zudich are grateful to the Slovenes for their invaluable help. PHOTO: Roman Sipic



Robert Krajnc sent an article in the News to Miodrag Kostic. PHOTO: Leon Vidic


LJUBLJANA - Twenty-one-month-old Kris Zudich of the Markovec settlement in Koper will fly a private gulfstream G450 plane from 60-year-old businessman Miodrag Kostic, home from Serbia's Vrbas, to Joze Pucnik Airport in Ljubljana at noon today. It will land at Los Angeles Airport, from where it will be transported to the Ronald Reagan Clinic. Little Kris, who has united all of Slovenia in his worst form of spinal muscular atrophy, will be traveling together for approximately 20 hours with a stopover. with 26-year-old father Matte Zudich, 30-year-old mother Ana Jerak, a specialist medical specialist from Ljubljana, and a pilot, co-pilot and one flight attendant will be on board. The plane, which has a full tank of kerosene about 10,000 miles away, will only stop once due to refueling in Canada.
He was moved by an article in the News
Otherwise, it will be an expensive flight. We have learned from unofficial but reliable sources that one hour of such a flight costs about 4000 euros, which means that an 80-hour flight, twice back and forth, will cost about 320,000 euros. All this will be paid by Miodrag Kostic, founder of MK Group from Belgrade, a holding company focused mainly on agricultural activity, but also a manager of companies with which he fully owns Gorenjska banka, Kempinski Hotel in Portorož, and is also the majority owner of Portorož Airport and more.


Robert Krajnc sent an article in the News to Miodrag Kostic. PHOTO: Leon Vidic

We also reveal that the director of the Portorož Airport, 49-year-old Robert Krajnc from Secovlje, who also has a grandson named Kris, was the philanthropist who was so badly affected by the story of the sick boy. And then he sent Miodrag Kostic an article that was published in the Slovenian News on September 24, and suggested that they give Chris a helping hand. Krajnc and his colleagues were collecting help for Kris on the day of Portorož Airport's Open Door Day on September 28, and remained in strict secrecy at Kostic's request for more than a month. Our sources told us that the latter would drop the plane and cover astronomical costs. transportation.
$ 4,000 costs an hour flight.
We also learned that a plane with Kris could fly from the airport in Portorož, which is only 17 kilometers away from his home, but because of bureaucratic obstacles, mainly thanks to the Ministry of the Environment and Spatial Planning, which has been intensively dealt with by Director Krajnc for a decade , this is not possible. The runway, which is 1200 meters long and 30 wide, is too short to safely take off in bad weather and is not allowed to be extended. ”Because the aircraft is full of fuel and consequently heavier, higher takeoff speed and longer the runway, Kris cannot fly from Portorož at the announced storm. If the runway was 200 meters longer, it could, "Krajnc explained. We also called Chris's parents. Ana Jerak's mother said the day before the flight that Kris was good, they were ready for the flight, and when asked if there were any fears about the route, she said that there was no special anxiety about the flight itself, although they had only flown once so far. this was April, and very briefly. "You know, we don't even have time to think about fear," she said. To receive the world's most expensive medicine, Chris will receive the world's most expensive single dose of 5.5 milligrams of zolgensma a week after his arrival. he must be at the latest by the age of two, completing it on 28 January. Two million euros have been deducted for the cure - the donation Slovenes have raised nearly 4 million - and Kris will return home after two or four months, respectively. Kris's mum and dad have all lived so far for the day their baby goes over the puddle and received the medicine and was eventually welcomed by a small but heartfelt Slovenian nation. For which, of course, they are grateful to everyone.
